It is possible to retrieve the username and password through the TCP service running on port 9000. Other brands using this platform and exposing the same issue may include Swann, Lorex, Night Owl, Zmodo, URMET, and KGuard Security.

vertices.shortDescription: Redis-server Scanner
vertices.fullDescription: This module scans for Redis server. By default Redis has no auth. If auth (password only) is used, it is then possible to execute a brute force attack on the server. This scanner will find open or password protected Redis servers and report back the server information

vertices.shortDescription: Rosewill RXS-3211 IP Camera Password Retriever
vertices.fullDescription: This module takes advantage of a protocol design issue with the Rosewill admin executable in order to retrieve passwords, allowing remote attackers to take administrative control over the device. Other similar IP Cameras such as Edimax, Hawking, Zonet, etc, are also believed to have the same flaw, but not fully tested. The protocol deisgn issue also allows attackers to reset passwords on the device.

vertices.shortDescription: SunRPC Portmap Program Enumerator
vertices.fullDescription: This module calls the target portmap service and enumerates all program entries and their running port numbers.

vertices.shortDescription: Novell ZENworks Configuration Management Preboot Service Remote File Access
vertices.fullDescription: This module exploits a directory traversal in the ZENworks Configuration Management. The vulnerability exists in the Preboot service and can be triggered by sending a specially crafted PROXY_CMD_FTP_FILE (opcode 0x21) packet to the 998/TCP port. This module has been successfully tested on Novell ZENworks Configuration Management 10 SP2 and SP3 over Windows.

vertices.shortDescription: MongoDB Login Utility
vertices.fullDescription: This module attempts to brute force authentication credentials for MongoDB. Note that, by default, MongoDB does not require authentication.

vertices.shortDescription: Motorola Timbuktu Service Detection
vertices.fullDescription: This module simply sends a packet to the Motorola Timbuktu service for detection.

vertices.shortDescription: Metasploit RPC Interface Login Utility
vertices.fullDescription: This module simply attempts to login to a Metasploit RPC interface using a specific user/pass.

vertices.shortDescription: Metasploit Web interface Login Utility
vertices.fullDescription: This module simply attempts to login to a Metasploit web interface using a specific user/pass.

vertices.shortDescription: MSSQL Password Hashdump
vertices.fullDescription: This module extracts the usernames and encrypted password hashes from a MSSQL server and stores them for later cracking. This module also saves information about the server version and table names, which can be used to seed the wordlist.

vertices.shortDescription: MSSQL Login Utility
vertices.fullDescription: This module simply queries the MSSQL instance for a specific user/pass (default is sa with blank).

vertices.shortDescription: MSSQL Ping Utility
vertices.fullDescription: This module simply queries the MSSQL instance for information.

vertices.shortDescription: MSSQL Schema Dump
vertices.fullDescription: This module attempts to extract the schema from a MSSQL Server Instance. It will disregard builtin and example DBs such as master,model,msdb, and tempdb. The module will create a note for each DB found, and store a YAML formatted output as loot for easy reading.

vertices.shortDescription: MySQL Authentication Bypass Password Dump
vertices.fullDescription: This module exploits a password bypass vulnerability in MySQL in order to extract the usernames and encrypted password hashes from a MySQL server. These hashes ares stored as loot for later cracking.

vertices.shortDescription: MYSQL File/Directory Enumerator
vertices.fullDescription: Enumerate files and directories using the MySQL load_file feature, for more information see the URL in the references.

vertices.shortDescription: MYSQL Password Hashdump
vertices.fullDescription: This module extracts the usernames and encrypted password hashes from a MySQL server and stores them for later cracking.

vertices.shortDescription: MySQL Login Utility
vertices.fullDescription: This module simply queries the MySQL instance for a specific user/pass (default is root with blank).

vertices.shortDescription: MYSQL Schema Dump
vertices.fullDescription: This module extracts the schema information from a MySQL DB server.

vertices.shortDescription: MySQL Server Version Enumeration
vertices.fullDescription: Enumerates the version of MySQL servers

vertices.shortDescription: NAT-PMP External Port Scanner
vertices.fullDescription: Scan NAT devices for their external listening ports using NAT-PMP

vertices.shortDescription: Nessus NTP Login Utility
vertices.fullDescription: This module attempts to authenticate to a Nessus NTP service.

vertices.shortDescription: Nessus XMLRPC Interface Login Utility
vertices.fullDescription: This module simply attempts to login to a Nessus XMLRPC interface using a specific user/pass.

vertices.shortDescription: Nessus XMLRPC Interface Ping Utility
vertices.fullDescription: This module simply attempts to find and check for Nessus XMLRPC interface.'

vertices.shortDescription: NetBIOS Information Discovery
vertices.fullDescription: Discover host information through NetBIOS

vertices.shortDescription: NetBIOS Information Discovery Prober
vertices.fullDescription: Discover host information using sequential NetBIOS Probes

vertices.shortDescription: NeXpose API Interface Login Utility
vertices.fullDescription: This module simply attempts to login to a NeXpose API interface using a specific user/pass.

vertices.shortDescription: NFS Mount Scanner
vertices.fullDescription: This module scans NFS mounts and their permissions.

vertices.shortDescription: NTP Monitor List Scanner
vertices.fullDescription: Obtain the list of recent clients from an NTP server

vertices.shortDescription: NTP Clock Variables Disclosure
vertices.fullDescription: This module reads the system internal NTP variables. These variables contain potentially sensitive information, such as the NTP software version, operating system version, peers, and more.

vertices.shortDescription: OpenVAS gsad Web interface Login Utility
vertices.fullDescription: This module simply attempts to login to a OpenVAS gsad interface using a specific user/pass.

vertices.shortDescription: OpenVAS OMP Login Utility
vertices.fullDescription: This module attempts to authenticate to an OpenVAS OMP service.

vertices.shortDescription: OpenVAS OTP Login Utility
vertices.fullDescription: This module attempts to authenticate to an OpenVAS OTP service.

vertices.shortDescription: Oracle Enterprise Manager Control SID Discovery
vertices.fullDescription: This module makes a request to the Oracle Enterprise Manager Control Console in an attempt to discover the SID.

vertices.shortDescription: Oracle iSQL*Plus Login Utility
vertices.fullDescription: This module attempts to authenticate against an Oracle ISQL*Plus administration web site using username and password combinations indicated by the USER_FILE, PASS_FILE, and USERPASS_FILE.  This module does not require a valid SID, but if one is defined, it will be used. Works against Oracle 9.2, 10.1 & 10.2 iSQL*Plus. This module will attempt to fingerprint the version and automatically select the correct POST request.

vertices.shortDescription: Oracle isqlplus SID Check
vertices.fullDescription: This module attempts to bruteforce the SID on the Oracle application server iSQL*Plus login pages. It does this by testing Oracle error responses returned in the HTTP response. Incorrect username/pass with a correct SID will produce an Oracle ORA-01017 error. Works against Oracle 9.2, 10.1 & 10.2 iSQL*Plus. This module will attempt to fingerprint the version and automatically select the correct POST request.

vertices.shortDescription: Oracle Password Hashdump
vertices.fullDescription: This module dumps the usernames and password hashes from Oracle given the proper Credentials and SID. These are then stored as loot for later cracking.

vertices.shortDescription: Oracle RDBMS Login Utility
vertices.fullDescription: This module attempts to authenticate against an Oracle RDBMS instance using username and password combinations indicated by the USER_FILE, PASS_FILE, and USERPASS_FILE options.

vertices.shortDescription: Oracle TNS Listener SID Bruteforce
vertices.fullDescription: This module queries the TNS listner for a valid Oracle database instance name (also known as a SID). Any response other than a "reject" will be considered a success. If a specific SID is provided, that SID will be attempted. Otherwise, SIDs read from the named file will be attempted in sequence instead.

vertices.shortDescription: Oracle TNS Listener SID Enumeration
vertices.fullDescription: This module simply queries the TNS listner for the Oracle SID. With Oracle 9.2.0.8 and above the listener will be protected and the SID will have to be bruteforced or guessed.

vertices.shortDescription: Oracle Application Server Spy Servlet SID Enumeration
vertices.fullDescription: This module makes a request to the Oracle Application Server in an attempt to discover the SID.

vertices.shortDescription: Oracle TNS Listener Service Version Query
vertices.fullDescription: This module simply queries the tnslsnr service for the Oracle build.

vertices.shortDescription: Oracle XML DB SID Discovery
vertices.fullDescription: This module simply makes a authenticated request to retrieve the sid from the Oracle XML DB httpd server.

vertices.shortDescription: Oracle XML DB SID Discovery via Brute Force
vertices.fullDescription: This module attempts to retrieve the sid from the Oracle XML DB httpd server, utilizing Pete Finnigan's default oracle password list.

vertices.shortDescription: PcAnywhere Login Scanner
vertices.fullDescription: This module will test pcAnywhere logins on a range of machines and report successful logins.

vertices.shortDescription: PcAnywhere TCP Service Discovery
vertices.fullDescription: Discover active pcAnywhere services through TCP

vertices.shortDescription: PcAnywhere UDP Service Discovery
vertices.fullDescription: Discover active pcAnywhere services through UDP

vertices.shortDescription: POP3 Login Utility
vertices.fullDescription: This module attempts to authenticate to an POP3 service.

vertices.shortDescription: POP3 Banner Grabber
vertices.fullDescription: POP3 Banner Grabber

vertices.shortDescription: TCP ACK Firewall Scanner
vertices.fullDescription: Map out firewall rulesets with a raw ACK scan. Any unfiltered ports found means a stateful firewall is not in place for them.

vertices.shortDescription: FTP Bounce Port Scanner
vertices.fullDescription: Enumerate TCP services via the FTP bounce PORT/LIST method, which can still come in handy every once in a while (I know of a server that still allows this just fine...).

vertices.shortDescription: TCP SYN Port Scanner
vertices.fullDescription: Enumerate open TCP services using a raw SYN scan.

vertices.shortDescription: TCP Port Scanner
vertices.fullDescription: Enumerate open TCP services

vertices.shortDescription: TCP "XMas" Port Scanner
vertices.fullDescription: Enumerate open|filtered TCP services using a raw "XMas" scan; this sends probes containing the FIN, PSH and URG flags.

vertices.shortDescription: PostgreSQL Database Name Command Line Flag Injection
vertices.fullDescription: This module can identify PostgreSQL 9.0, 9.1, and 9.2 servers that are vulnerable to command-line flag injection through CVE-2013-1899. This can lead to denial of service, privilege escalation, or even arbitrary code execution.

vertices.shortDescription: Postgres Password Hashdump
vertices.fullDescription: This module extracts the usernames and encrypted password hashes from a Postgres server and stores them for later cracking.

vertices.shortDescription: PostgreSQL Login Utility
vertices.fullDescription: This module attempts to authenticate against a PostgreSQL instance using username and password combinations indicated by the USER_FILE, PASS_FILE, and USERPASS_FILE options.

vertices.shortDescription: Postgres Schema Dump
vertices.fullDescription: This module extracts the schema information from a Postgres server.

vertices.shortDescription: PostgreSQL Version Probe
vertices.fullDescription: Enumerates the verion of PostgreSQL servers.

vertices.shortDescription: MS12-020 Microsoft Remote Desktop Checker
vertices.fullDescription: This module checks a range of hosts for the MS12-020 vulnerability. This does not cause a DoS on the target.

vertices.shortDescription: Rogue Gateway Detection: Receiver
vertices.fullDescription: This module listens for replies to the requests sent by  the rogue_send module. The RPORT, CPORT, and ECHOID values  must match the rogue_send parameters used exactly.

vertices.shortDescription: Rogue Gateway Detection: Sender
vertices.fullDescription: This module send a series of TCP SYN and ICMP ECHO requests  to each internal target host, spoofing the source address of an external  system running the rogue_recv module. This allows the system running  the rogue_recv module to determine what external IP a given internal  system is using as its default route.

vertices.shortDescription: rexec Authentication Scanner
vertices.fullDescription: This module will test an rexec service on a range of machines and report successful logins.  NOTE: This module requires access to bind to privileged ports (below 1024).

vertices.shortDescription: rlogin Authentication Scanner
vertices.fullDescription: This module will test an rlogin service on a range of machines and report successful logins.  NOTE: This module requires access to bind to privileged ports (below 1024).

vertices.shortDescription: rsh Authentication Scanner
vertices.fullDescription: This module will test a shell (rsh) service on a range of machines and report successful logins.  NOTE: This module requires access to bind to privileged ports (below 1024).

vertices.shortDescription: SAP CTC Service Verb Tampering User Management
vertices.fullDescription: This module exploits an authentication bypass vulnerability in SAP NetWeaver CTC service. The service is vulnerable to verb tampering allowing for unauthorised OS user management. Information about resolution should be available at SAP notes 1589525 and 1624450 (authentication required).

vertices.shortDescription: SAP ICF /sap/public/info Service Sensitive Information Gathering
vertices.fullDescription: This module uses the /sap/public/info service within SAP Internet Communication Framework (ICF) to obtain the operating system version, SAP version, IP address and other information.

vertices.shortDescription: SAP URL Scanner
vertices.fullDescription: This module scans for commonly found SAP Internet Communication Manager URLs and outputs return codes for the user.

vertices.shortDescription: SAP Management Console ABAP Syslog Disclosure
vertices.fullDescription: This module simply attempts to extract the ABAP syslog through the SAP Management Console SOAP Interface.

vertices.shortDescription: SAP Management Console Brute Force
vertices.fullDescription: This module simply attempts to brute force the username | password for the SAP Management Console SOAP Interface. By setting the SAP SID value, a list of default SAP users can be tested without needing to set a USERNAME or USER_FILE value. The default usernames are stored in ./data/wordlists/sap_common.txt (the value of SAP SID is automatically inserted into the username to replce <SAPSID>).

vertices.shortDescription: SAP Management Console Extract Users
vertices.fullDescription: This module simply attempts to extract SAP users from the ABAP Syslog through the SAP Management Console SOAP Interface.

vertices.shortDescription: SAP Management Console Get Access Points
vertices.fullDescription: This module simply attempts to output a list of SAP access points through the SAP Management Console SOAP Interface.

vertices.shortDescription: SAP Management Console getEnvironment
vertices.fullDescription: This module simply attempts to identify SAP Environment settings through the SAP Management Console SOAP Interface.

vertices.shortDescription: SAP Management Console Get Logfile
vertices.fullDescription: This module simply attempts to download available logfiles and developer tracefiles through the SAP Management Console SOAP Interface. Please use the sap_mgmt_con_listlogfiles extension to view a list of available files.

vertices.shortDescription: SAP Management Console GetProcessList
vertices.fullDescription: This module attempts to list SAP processes through the SAP Management Console SOAP Interface

vertices.shortDescription: SAP Management Console Get Process Parameters
vertices.fullDescription: This module simply attempts to output a SAP process parameters and configuration settings through the SAP Management Console SOAP Interface.

vertices.shortDescription: SAP Management Console Instance Properties
vertices.fullDescription: This module simply attempts to identify the instance properties through the SAP Management Console SOAP Interface.

vertices.shortDescription: SAP Management Console List Logfiles
vertices.fullDescription: This module simply attempts to output a list of available logfiles and developer tracefiles through the SAP Management Console SOAP Interface.

vertices.shortDescription: SAP Management Console getStartProfile
vertices.fullDescription: This module simply attempts to acces the SAP startup profile through the SAP Management Console SOAP Interface.

vertices.shortDescription: SAP Management Console Version Detection
vertices.fullDescription: This module simply attempts to identify the version of SAP through the SAP Management Console SOAP Interface.

vertices.shortDescription: SAPRouter Admin Request
vertices.fullDescription: Display the remote connection table from a SAPRouter.

vertices.shortDescription: SAP Service Discovery
vertices.fullDescription: Scans for listening SAP services.

vertices.shortDescription: SAP SMB Relay Abuse
vertices.fullDescription: This module exploits provides several SMB Relay abuse through different SAP services and functions. The attack is done through specially crafted requests including a UNC Path which will be accessing by the SAP system while trying to process the request. In order to get the hashes the auxiliary/server/capture/smb module can be used.

vertices.shortDescription: SAP /sap/bc/soap/rfc SOAP Service BAPI_USER_CREATE1 Function User Creation
vertices.fullDescription: This module makes use of the BAPI_USER_CREATE1 function, through the SOAP /sap/bc/soap/rfc service, for creating/modifying users on a SAP.

vertices.shortDescription: SAP /sap/bc/soap/rfc SOAP Service RFC_PING Login Brute Forcer
vertices.fullDescription: This module attempts to brute force SAP username and passwords through the /sap/bc/soap/rfc SOAP service, using RFC_PING function. Default clients can be tested without needing to set a CLIENT. Common/Default user and password combinations can be tested just setting DEFAULT_CRED variable to true. These default combinations are stored in MSF_DATA_DIRECTORY/wordlists/sap_default.txt.

vertices.shortDescription: SAP /sap/bc/soap/rfc SOAP Service SXPG_CALL_SYSTEM Function Command Injection
vertices.fullDescription: This module makes use of the SXPG_CALL_SYSTEM Remote Function Call, through the use of the /sap/bc/soap/rfc SOAP service, to inject and execute OS commands.

vertices.shortDescription: SAP /sap/bc/soap/rfc SOAP Service SXPG_COMMAND_EXEC Function Command Injection
vertices.fullDescription: This module makes use of the SXPG_COMMAND_EXEC Remote Function Call, through the use of the /sap/bc/soap/rfc SOAP service, to inject and execute OS commands.

vertices.shortDescription: SAP SOAP RFC EPS_GET_DIRECTORY_LISTING Directories Information Disclosure
vertices.fullDescription: This module abuses the SAP NetWeaver EPS_GET_DIRECTORY_LISTING function, on the SAP SOAP RFC Service, to check for remote directory existence and get the number of entries on it. The module can also be used to capture SMB hashes by using a fake SMB share as DIR.

vertices.shortDescription: SAP SOAP RFC PFL_CHECK_OS_FILE_EXISTENCE File Existence Check
vertices.fullDescription: This module abuses the SAP NetWeaver PFL_CHECK_OS_FILE_EXISTENCE function, on the SAP SOAP RFC Service, to check for files existence on the remote file system. The module can also be used to capture SMB hashes by using a fake SMB share as FILEPATH.

vertices.shortDescription: SAP /sap/bc/soap/rfc SOAP Service RFC_PING Function Service Discovery
vertices.fullDescription: This module makes use of the RFC_PING function, through the /sap/bc/soap/rfc SOAP service, to test connectivity to remote RFC destinations.

vertices.shortDescription: SAP /sap/bc/soap/rfc SOAP Service RFC_READ_TABLE Function Dump Data
vertices.fullDescription: This module makes use of the RFC_READ_TABLE Function to read data from tables using the /sap/bc/soap/rfc SOAP service.

vertices.shortDescription: SAP SOAP RFC RZL_READ_DIR_LOCAL Directory Contents Listing
vertices.fullDescription: This module exploits the SAP NetWeaver RZL_READ_DIR_LOCAL function, on the SAP SOAP RFC Service, to enumerate directory contents. It returns only the first 32 characters of the filename since they are truncated. The module can also be used to capture SMB hashes by using a fake SMB share as DIR.

vertices.shortDescription: SAP /sap/bc/soap/rfc SOAP Service SUSR_RFC_USER_INTERFACE Function User Creation
vertices.fullDescription: This module makes use of the SUSR_RFC_USER_INTERFACE function, through the SOAP /sap/bc/soap/rfc service, for creating/modifying users on a SAP.

vertices.shortDescription: SAP /sap/bc/soap/rfc SOAP Service SXPG_CALL_SYSTEM Function Command Execution
vertices.fullDescription: This module makes use of the SXPG_CALL_SYSTEM Remote Function Call, through the use of the /sap/bc/soap/rfc SOAP service to execute OS commands as configured in the SM69 transaction.

vertices.shortDescription: SAP SOAP RFC SXPG_COMMAND_EXECUTE
vertices.fullDescription: This module makes use of the SXPG_COMMAND_EXECUTE Remote Function Call, through the use of the /sap/bc/soap/rfc SOAP service to execute OS commands as configured in the SM69 transaction.

vertices.shortDescription: SAP /sap/bc/soap/rfc SOAP Service RFC_SYSTEM_INFO Function Sensitive Information Gathering
vertices.fullDescription: This module makes use of the RFC_SYSTEM_INFO Function to obtain the operating system version, SAP version, IP address and other information through the use of the /sap/bc/soap/rfc SOAP service.

vertices.shortDescription: SAP /sap/bc/soap/rfc SOAP Service TH_SAPREL Function Information Disclosure
vertices.fullDescription: This module attempts to identify software, OS and DB versions through the SAP function TH_SAPREL using the /sap/bc/soap/rfc SOAP service.

vertices.shortDescription: SAP Web GUI Login Brute Forcer
vertices.fullDescription: This module attempts to brute force SAP username and passwords through the SAP Web GUI service. Default clients can be tested without needing to set a CLIENT. Common and default user/password combinations can be tested just setting the DEFAULT_CRED variable to true. The MSF_DATA_DIRECTORY/wordlists/sap_default.txt path store stores these default combinations.

vertices.shortDescription: Digi ADDP Remote Reboot Initiator
vertices.fullDescription: Reboot Digi International based equipment through the ADDP service

vertices.shortDescription: Digi ADDP Information Discovery
vertices.fullDescription: Discover host information through the Digi International ADDP service

vertices.shortDescription: Digi RealPort Serial Server Port Scanner
vertices.fullDescription: Identify active ports on RealPort-enabled serial servers.

vertices.shortDescription: Digi RealPort Serial Server Version
vertices.fullDescription: Detect serial servers that speak the RealPort protocol.

vertices.shortDescription: Indusoft WebStudio NTWebServer Remote File Access
vertices.fullDescription: This module exploits a directory traversal vulnerability in Indusoft WebStudio. The vulnerability exists in the NTWebServer component and allows to read arbitrary remote files with the privileges of the NTWebServer process. The module has been tested successfully on Indusoft WebStudio 6.1 SP6.

vertices.shortDescription: Koyo DirectLogic PLC Password Brute Force Utility
vertices.fullDescription: This module attempts to authenticate to a locked Koyo DirectLogic PLC. The PLC uses a restrictive passcode, which can be A0000000 through A9999999. The "A" prefix can also be changed by the administrator to any other character, which can be set through the PREFIX option of this module.  This module is based on the original 'koyobrute.rb' Basecamp module from DigitalBond.

vertices.shortDescription: Modbus Unit ID and Station ID Enumerator
vertices.fullDescription: Modbus is a cleartext protocol used in common SCADA systems, developed originally as a serial-line (RS232) async protocol, and later transformed to IP, which is called ModbusTCP. default tcpport is 502.  This module sends a command (0x04, read input register) to the modbus endpoint. If this command is sent to the correct unit-id, it returns with the same funcion-id. if not, it should be added 0x80, so that it sys 0x84, and an exception-code follows which do not interest us. This does not always happen, but at least the first 4 bytes in the return-packet should be exact the same as what was sent.  You can change port, ip and the scan-range for unit-id. There is also added a value - BENICE - to make the scanner sleep a second or more between probes. We have seen installations where scanning too many too fast works like a DoS.

vertices.shortDescription: Modbus Client Utility
vertices.fullDescription: This module sends a command (0x06, write to one register) to a Modbus endpoint. You can change port, IP, register to write and data to write, as well as unit-id.  Modbus is a clear text protocol used in common SCADA systems, developed originally as a serial-line (RS232) async protocol. It is later transformed to IP, which is called ModbusTCP.  There are a handful of functions which are possible to do, but this client has only implemented the function "write value to register" (\x48).

vertices.shortDescription: Modbus Version Scanner
vertices.fullDescription: This module detects the Modbus service, tested on a SAIA PCD1.M2 system. Modbus is a clear text protocol used in common SCADA systems, developed originally as a serial-line (RS232) async protocol, and later transformed to IP, which is called ModbusTCP.

vertices.shortDescription: Sielco Sistemi Winlog Remote File Access
vertices.fullDescription: This module exploits a directory traversal in Sielco Sistemi Winlog. The vulnerability exists in the Runtime.exe service and can be triggered by sending a specially crafted packet to the 46824/TCP port. This module has been successfully tested on Sielco Sistemi Winlog Lite 2.07.14.

vertices.shortDescription: SIP Username Enumerator (UDP)
vertices.fullDescription: Scan for numeric username/extensions using OPTIONS/REGISTER requests

vertices.shortDescription: SIP Username Enumerator (TCP)
vertices.fullDescription: Scan for numeric username/extensions using OPTIONS/REGISTER requests

vertices.shortDescription: SIP Endpoint Scanner (UDP)
vertices.fullDescription: Scan for SIP devices using OPTIONS requests

vertices.shortDescription: SIP Endpoint Scanner (TCP)
vertices.fullDescription: Scan for SIP devices using OPTIONS requests

vertices.shortDescription: SIPDroid Extension Grabber
vertices.fullDescription: This module exploits a leak of extension/SIP Gateway  on SIPDroid 1.6.1 beta, 2.0.1 beta, 2.2 beta (tested in Android 2.1 and 2.2 - official Motorola release)  (other versions may be affected).

vertices.shortDescription: SMB Session Pipe Auditor
vertices.fullDescription: Determine what named pipes are accessible over SMB

vertices.shortDescription: SMB Session Pipe DCERPC Auditor
vertices.fullDescription: Determine what DCERPC services are accessible over a SMB pipe

vertices.shortDescription: Microsoft Windows Authenticated Logged In Users Enumeration
vertices.fullDescription: This module uses a valid administrator username and password to enumerate users currently logged in, using a similar technique than the "psexec" utility provided by SysInternals. It uses reg.exe to query the HKU base registry key.

vertices.shortDescription: SMB 2.0 Protocol Detection
vertices.fullDescription: Detect systems that support the SMB 2.0 protocol

vertices.shortDescription: SMB Share Enumeration
vertices.fullDescription: Determine what shares are provided by the SMB service

vertices.shortDescription: SMB User Enumeration (SAM EnumUsers)
vertices.fullDescription: Determine what local users exist via the SAM RPC service

vertices.shortDescription: SMB Domain User Enumeration
vertices.fullDescription: Determine what domain users are logged into a remote system via a DCERPC to NetWkstaUserEnum.

vertices.shortDescription: SMB Login Check Scanner
vertices.fullDescription: This module will test a SMB login on a range of machines and report successful logins. If you have loaded a database plugin and connected to a database this module will record successful logins and hosts so you can track your access.

vertices.shortDescription: SMB Local User Enumeration (LookupSid)
vertices.fullDescription: Determine what users exist via brute force SID lookups. This module can enumerate both local and domain accounts by setting ACTION to either LOCAL or DOMAIN

vertices.shortDescription: SMB Version Detection
vertices.fullDescription: Display version information about each system

vertices.shortDescription: SMTP User Enumeration Utility
vertices.fullDescription: The SMTP service has two internal commands that allow the enumeration of users: VRFY (confirming the names of valid users) and EXPN (which reveals the actual address of users aliases and lists of e-mail (mailing lists)). Through the implementation of these SMTP commands can reveal a list of valid users.

vertices.shortDescription: SMTP Banner Grabber
vertices.fullDescription: SMTP Banner Grabber

vertices.shortDescription: AIX SNMP Scanner Auxiliary Module
vertices.fullDescription: AIX SNMP Scanner Auxiliary Module

vertices.shortDescription: Cisco IOS SNMP Configuration Grabber (TFTP)
vertices.fullDescription: This module will download the startup or running configuration from a Cisco IOS device using SNMP and TFTP. A read-write SNMP community is required. The SNMP community scanner module can assist in identifying a read-write community. The target must be able to connect back to the Metasploit system and the use of NAT will cause the TFTP transfer to fail.

vertices.shortDescription: Cisco IOS SNMP File Upload (TFTP)
vertices.fullDescription: This module will copy file to a Cisco IOS device using SNMP and TFTP. A read-write SNMP community is required. The SNMP community scanner module can assist in identifying a read-write community. The target must be able to connect back to the Metasploit system and the use of NAT will cause the TFTP transfer to fail.

vertices.shortDescription: SNMP Enumeration Module
vertices.fullDescription: This module allows enumeration of any devices with SNMP protocol support. It supports hardware, software, and network information. The default community used is "public".

vertices.shortDescription: SNMP Windows SMB Share Enumeration
vertices.fullDescription: This module will use LanManager OID values to enumerate SMB shares on a Windows system via SNMP

vertices.shortDescription: SNMP Windows Username Enumeration
vertices.fullDescription: This module will use LanManager OID values to enumerate local user accounts on a Windows system via SNMP

vertices.shortDescription: SNMP Community Scanner
vertices.fullDescription: Scan for SNMP devices using common community names

vertices.shortDescription: SNMP Set Module
vertices.fullDescription: This module, similar to snmpset tool, uses the SNMP SET request to set information on a network entity. A OID (numeric notation) and a value are required. Target device must permit write access.

vertices.shortDescription: Xerox WorkCentre User Enumeration (SNMP)
vertices.fullDescription: This module will do user enumeration based on the Xerox WorkCentre present on the network. SNMP is used to extract the usernames.

vertices.shortDescription: SSH Public Key Acceptance Scanner
vertices.fullDescription: This module can determine what public keys are configured for key-based authentication across a range of machines, users, and sets of known keys. The SSH protocol indicates whether a particular key is accepted prior to the client performing the actual signed authentication request. To use this module, a text file containing one or more SSH keys should be provided. These can be private or public, so long as no passphrase is set on the private keys.  If you have loaded a database plugin and connected to a database this module will record authorized public keys and hosts so you can track your process.   Key files may be a single public (unencrypted) key, or several public keys concatenated together as an ASCII text file. Non-key data should be silently ignored. Private keys will only utilize the public key component stored within the key file.

vertices.shortDescription: SSH Login Check Scanner
vertices.fullDescription: This module will test ssh logins on a range of machines and report successful logins. If you have loaded a database plugin and connected to a database this module will record successful logins and hosts so you can track your access.

vertices.shortDescription: SSH Public Key Login Scanner
vertices.fullDescription: This module will test ssh logins on a range of machines using a defined private key file, and report successful logins. If you have loaded a database plugin and connected to a database this module will record successful logins and hosts so you can track your access.  Note that password-protected key files will not function with this module -- it is designed specifically for unencrypted (passwordless) keys.  Key files may be a single private (unencrypted) key, or several private keys concatenated together as an ASCII text file. Non-key data should be silently ignored.

vertices.shortDescription: SSH Version Scanner
vertices.fullDescription: Detect SSH Version.

vertices.shortDescription: Wardialer
vertices.fullDescription: Scan for dial-up systems that are connected to modems and answer telephony indials.

vertices.shortDescription: Lantronix Telnet Password Recovery
vertices.fullDescription: This module retrieves the setup record from Lantronix serial-to-ethernet devices via the config port (30718/udp, enabled by default) and extracts the telnet password. It has been tested successfully on a Lantronix Device Server with software version V5.8.0.1.

vertices.shortDescription: Lantronix Telnet Service Banner Detection
vertices.fullDescription: Detect Lantronix telnet services

vertices.shortDescription: Telnet Service Encyption Key ID Overflow Detection
vertices.fullDescription: Detect telnet services vulnerable to the encrypt option Key ID overflow (BSD-derived telnetd)

vertices.shortDescription: Telnet Login Check Scanner
vertices.fullDescription: This module will test a telnet login on a range of machines and report successful logins. If you have loaded a database plugin and connected to a database this module will record successful logins and hosts so you can track your access.

vertices.shortDescription: RuggedCom Telnet Password Generator
vertices.fullDescription: This module will calculate the password for the hard-coded hidden username "factory" in the RuggedCom Rugged Operating System (ROS). The password is dynamically generated based on the devices MAC address.

vertices.shortDescription: Telnet Service Banner Detection
vertices.fullDescription: Detect telnet services

vertices.shortDescription: IpSwitch WhatsUp Gold TFTP Directory Traversal
vertices.fullDescription: This modules exploits a directory traversal vulnerability in IpSwitch WhatsUp Gold's TFTP service.

vertices.shortDescription: NetDecision 4.2 TFTP Directory Traversal
vertices.fullDescription: This modules exploits a directory traversal vulnerability in NetDecision 4.2 TFTP service.

vertices.shortDescription: TFTP Brute Forcer
vertices.fullDescription: This module uses a dictionary to brute force valid TFTP image names from a TFTP server.

vertices.shortDescription: UPnP SSDP M-SEARCH Information Discovery
vertices.fullDescription: Discover information from UPnP-enabled systems

vertices.shortDescription: VMWare ESX/ESXi Fingerprint Scanner
vertices.fullDescription: This module accesses the web API interfaces for VMware ESX/ESXi servers and attempts to identify version information for that server.

vertices.shortDescription: VMWare Authentication Daemon Login Scanner
vertices.fullDescription: This module will test vmauthd logins on a range of machines and  report successful logins.

vertices.shortDescription: VMWare Authentication Daemon Version Scanner
vertices.fullDescription: This module will identify information about a host through the  vmauthd service.

vertices.shortDescription: VMWare Enumerate Permissions
vertices.fullDescription: This module will log into the Web API of VMWare and try to enumerate all the user/group permissions. Unlike enum suers this is only users and groups that specifically have permissions defined within the VMware product

vertices.shortDescription: VMWare Enumerate Active Sessions
vertices.fullDescription: This module will log into the Web API of VMWare and try to enumerate all the login sessions.

vertices.shortDescription: VMWare Enumerate User Accounts
vertices.fullDescription: This module will log into the Web API of VMWare and try to enumerate all the user accounts. If the VMware instance is connected to one or more domains, it will try to enumerate domain users as well.

vertices.shortDescription: VMWare Enumerate Virtual Machines
vertices.fullDescription: This module attempts to discover virtual machines on any VMWare instance running the web interface. This would include ESX/ESXi and VMWare Server.

vertices.shortDescription: VMWare Enumerate Host Details
vertices.fullDescription: This module attempts to enumerate information about the host systems through the VMWare web API. This can include information about the hardware installed on the host machine.

vertices.shortDescription: VMWare Web Login Scanner
vertices.fullDescription: This module attempts to authenticate to the VMWare HTTP service for VmWare Server, ESX, and ESXI

vertices.shortDescription: VMWare Screenshot Stealer
vertices.fullDescription: This module uses supplied login credentials to connect to VMWare via the web interface. It then searches through the datastores looking for screenshots. It will downlaod any screenshots it finds and save them as loot.

vertices.shortDescription: VNC Authentication Scanner
vertices.fullDescription: This module will test a VNC server on a range of machines and report successful logins. Currently it supports RFB protocol version 3.3, 3.7, and 3.8 using the VNC challenge response authentication method.

vertices.shortDescription: VNC Authentication None Detection
vertices.fullDescription: Detect VNC servers that support the "None" authentication method.

vertices.shortDescription: Telephone Line Voice Scanner
vertices.fullDescription: This module dials a range of phone numbers and records audio from each answered call

vertices.shortDescription: VxWorks WDB Agent Boot Parameter Scanner
vertices.fullDescription: Scan for exposed VxWorks wdbrpc daemons and dump the boot parameters from memory

vertices.shortDescription: VxWorks WDB Agent Version Scanner
vertices.fullDescription: Scan for exposed VxWorks wdbrpc daemons

vertices.shortDescription: WinRM Authentication Method Detection
vertices.fullDescription: This module sends a request to an HTTP/HTTPS service to see if it is a WinRM service. If it is a WinRM service, it also gathers the Authentication Methods supported.

vertices.shortDescription: WinRM Command Runner
vertices.fullDescription: This module runs arbitrary Windows commands using the WinRM Service

vertices.shortDescription: WinRM Login Utility
vertices.fullDescription: This module attempts to authenticate to a WinRM service. It currently works only if the remote end allows Negotiate(NTLM) authentication. Kerberos is not currently supported. Please note: in order to use this module without SSL, the 'AllowUnencrypted' winrm option must be set. Otherwise adjust the port and set the SSL options in the module as appropriate.

vertices.shortDescription: WinRM WQL Query Runner
vertices.fullDescription: This module runs WQL queries against remote WinRM Services. Authentication is required. Currently only works with NTLM auth. Please note in order to use this module, the 'AllowUnencrypted' winrm option must be set.

vertices.shortDescription: X11 No-Auth Scanner
vertices.fullDescription: This module scans for X11 servers that allow anyone to connect without authentication.

vertices.shortDescription: HTTP Client Automatic Exploiter
vertices.fullDescription: This module has three actions. The first (and the default) is 'WebServer' which uses a combination of client-side and server-side techniques to fingerprint HTTP clients and then automatically exploit them. Next is 'DefangedDetection' which does only the fingerprinting part. Lastly, 'list' simply prints the names of all exploit modules that would be used by the WebServer action given the current MATCH and EXCLUDE options.  Also adds a 'list' command which is the same as running with ACTION=list.

vertices.shortDescription: Authentication Capture: DRDA (DB2, Informix, Derby)
vertices.fullDescription: This module provides a fake DRDA (DB2, Informix, Derby) server  that is designed to capture authentication credentials.

vertices.shortDescription: Authentication Capture: FTP
vertices.fullDescription: This module provides a fake FTP service that is designed to capture authentication credentials.

vertices.shortDescription: Authentication Capture: HTTP
vertices.fullDescription: This module provides a fake HTTP service that  is designed to capture authentication credentials.

vertices.shortDescription: HTTP Client Basic Authentication Credential Collector
vertices.fullDescription: This module responds to all requests for resources with a HTTP 401. This should cause most browsers to prompt for a credential. If the user enters Basic Auth creds they are sent to the console.  This may be helpful in some phishing expeditions where it is possible to embed a resource into a page.  This attack is discussed in Chapter 3 of The Tangled Web by Michal Zalewski.

vertices.shortDescription: Capture: HTTP JavaScript Keylogger
vertices.fullDescription: This modules runs a web server that demonstrates keystroke logging through JavaScript. The DEMO option can be set to enable a page that demonstrates this technique. Future improvements will allow for a configurable template to be used with this module. To use this module with an existing web page, simply add a script source tag pointing to the URL of this service ending in the .js extension. For example, if URIPATH is set to "test", the following URL will load this script into the calling site: http://server:port/test/anything.js

vertices.shortDescription: HTTP Client MS Credential Catcher
vertices.fullDescription: This module attempts to quietly catch NTLM/LM Challenge hashes.

vertices.shortDescription: Authentication Capture: IMAP
vertices.fullDescription: This module provides a fake IMAP service that  is designed to capture authentication credentials.

vertices.shortDescription: Authentication Capture: MSSQL
vertices.fullDescription: This module provides a fake MSSQL service that  is designed to capture authentication credentials. The modules  supports both the weak encoded database logins as well as Windows  logins (NTLM).

vertices.shortDescription: Authentication Capture: MySQL
vertices.fullDescription: This module provides a fake MySQL service that is designed to capture authentication credentials. It captures challenge and response pairs that can be supplied to Cain or JtR for cracking.

vertices.shortDescription: Authentication Capture: POP3
vertices.fullDescription: This module provides a fake POP3 service that  is designed to capture authentication credentials.

vertices.shortDescription: Authentication Capture: PostgreSQL
vertices.fullDescription: This module provides a fake PostgreSQL service that is designed to capture clear-text authentication credentials.

vertices.shortDescription: Printjob Capture Service
vertices.fullDescription: This module is designed to listen for PJL or PostScript print jobs. Once a print job is detected it is saved to loot. The captured printjob can then be forwarded on to another printer (required for LPR printjobs). Resulting PCL/PS files can be read with GhostScript/GhostPCL.  Note, this module does not yet support IPP connections.

vertices.shortDescription: Authentication Capture: SIP
vertices.fullDescription: This module provides a fake SIP service that is designed to capture authentication credentials. It captures challenge and response pairs that can be supplied to Cain or JtR for cracking.

vertices.shortDescription: Authentication Capture: SMB
vertices.fullDescription: This module provides a SMB service that can be used to  capture the challenge-response password hashes of SMB client  systems. Responses sent by this service have by default the  configurable challenge string (\x11\x22\x33\x44\x55\x66\x77\x88),  allowing for easy cracking using Cain & Abel, L0phtcrack  or John the ripper (with jumbo patch).   To exploit this, the target system must try to authenticate  to this module. The easiest way to force a SMB authentication attempt  is by embedding a UNC path (\\SERVER\SHARE) into a web page or  email message. When the victim views the web page or email, their  system will automatically connect to the server specified in the UNC  share (the IP address of the system running this module) and attempt  to authenticate.

vertices.shortDescription: Authentication Capture: SMTP
vertices.fullDescription: This module provides a fake SMTP service that  is designed to capture authentication credentials.

vertices.shortDescription: Authentication Capture: Telnet
vertices.fullDescription: This module provides a fake Telnet service that  is designed to capture authentication credentials. DONTs  and WONTs are sent to the client for all option negotiations,  except for ECHO at the time of the password prompt since  the server controls that for a bit more realism.

vertices.shortDescription: Authentication Capture: VNC
vertices.fullDescription: This module provides a fake VNC service that  is designed to capture authentication credentials.

vertices.shortDescription: DHCP Server
vertices.fullDescription: This module provides a DHCP service

vertices.shortDescription: DNS Spoofing Helper Service
vertices.fullDescription: This module provides a DNS service that returns TXT  records indicating information about the querying service.  Based on Dino Dai Zovi DNS code from Karma.

vertices.shortDescription: Fake DNS Service
vertices.fullDescription: This module provides a DNS service that redirects  all queries to a particular address.

vertices.shortDescription: FTP File Server
vertices.fullDescription: This module provides a FTP service

vertices.shortDescription: HTTP Client MS Credential Relayer
vertices.fullDescription: This module relays negotiated NTLM Credentials from an HTTP server to multiple protocols. Currently, this module supports relaying to SMB and HTTP.  Complicated custom attacks requiring multiple requests that depend on each other can be written using the SYNC* options. For example, a CSRF-style attack might first set an HTTP_GET request with a unique SNYNCID and set an HTTP_POST request with a SYNCFILE, which contains logic to look through the database and parse out important values, such as the CSRF token or authentication cookies, setting these as configuration options, and finally create a web page with iframe elements pointing at the HTTP_GET and HTTP_POSTs.

vertices.shortDescription: ICMP Exfiltration Service
vertices.fullDescription: This module is designed to provide a server-side component to receive and store files exfiltrated over ICMP echo request packets.  To use this module you will need to send an initial ICMP echo request containing the specific start trigger (defaults to '^BOF') this can be followed by the filename being sent (or a random filename can be assisnged). All data received from this source will automatically be added to the receive buffer until an ICMP echo request containing a specific end trigger (defaults to '^EOL') is received.  Suggested Client: Data can be sent from the client using a variety of tools. One such example is nping (included with the NMAP suite of tools) - usage: nping --icmp 10.0.0.1 --data-string "BOFtest.txt" -c1

vertices.shortDescription: PXE Boot Exploit Server
vertices.fullDescription: This module provides a PXE server, running a DHCP and TFTP server. The default configuration loads a linux kernel and initrd into memory that reads the hard drive; placing a payload to install metsvc, disable the firewall, and add a new user metasploit on any Windows partition seen, and add a uid 0 user with username and password metasploit to any linux partition seen. The windows user will have the password p@SSw0rd!123456 (in case of complexity requirements) and will be added to the administrators group.  Note: the displayed IP address of a target is the address this DHCP server handed out, not the "normal" IP address the host uses.

vertices.shortDescription: Socks4a Proxy Server
vertices.fullDescription: This module provides a socks4a proxy server that uses the builtin Metasploit routing to relay connections.

vertices.shortDescription: SOCKS Proxy UNC Path Redirection
vertices.fullDescription: This module provides a Socks proxy service  that redirects all HTTP requests to a web page that  loads a UNC path.

vertices.shortDescription: TFTP File Server
vertices.fullDescription: This module provides a TFTP service

vertices.shortDescription: Cross Platform Webkit File Dropper
vertices.fullDescription: This module exploits a XSLT vulnerability in Webkit to drop ASCII or UTF-8 files to the target file-system. By default, the file will be dropped in C:\Program Files\

vertices.shortDescription: WPAD.dat File Server
vertices.fullDescription: This module generates a valid wpad.dat file for WPAD mitm attacks. Usually this module is used in combination with DNS attacks or the 'NetBIOS Name Service Spoofer' module. Please remember as the server will be running by default on TCP port 80 you will need the required privileges to open that port.

vertices.shortDescription: pSnuffle Packet Sniffer
vertices.fullDescription: This module sniffs passwords like dsniff did in the past

vertices.shortDescription: ARP Spoof
vertices.fullDescription: Spoof ARP replies and poison remote ARP caches to conduct IP address spoofing or a denial of service.

vertices.shortDescription: Forge Cisco DTP Packets
vertices.fullDescription: This module forges DTP packets to initialize a trunk port.

vertices.shortDescription: DNS BailiWicked Domain Attack
vertices.fullDescription: This exploit attacks a fairly ubiquitous flaw in DNS implementations which Dan Kaminsky found and disclosed ~Jul 2008. This exploit replaces the target domains nameserver entries in a vulnerable DNS cache server. This attack works by sending random hostname queries to the target DNS server coupled with spoofed replies to those queries from the authoritative nameservers for that domain. Eventually, a guessed ID will match, the spoofed packet will get accepted, and the nameserver entries for the target domain will be replaced by the server specified in the NEWDNS option of this exploit.

vertices.shortDescription: DNS BailiWicked Host Attack
vertices.fullDescription: This exploit attacks a fairly ubiquitous flaw in DNS implementations which Dan Kaminsky found and disclosed ~Jul 2008. This exploit caches a single malicious host entry into the target nameserver by sending random hostname queries to the target DNS server coupled with spoofed replies to those queries from the authoritative nameservers for that domain. Eventually, a guessed ID will match, the spoofed packet will get accepted, and due to the additional hostname entry being within bailiwick constraints of the original request the malicious host entry will get cached.

vertices.shortDescription: DNS Lookup Result Comparison
vertices.fullDescription: This module can be used to determine differences  in the cache entries between two DNS servers. This is  primarily useful for detecting cache poisoning attacks,  but can also be used to detect geo-location loadbalancing.

vertices.shortDescription: LLMNR Spoofer
vertices.fullDescription: LLMNR (Link-local Multicast Name Resolution) is the successor of NetBIOS (Windows Vista and up) and is used to resolve the names of neighboring computers. This module forges LLMNR responses by listening for LLMNR requests sent to the LLMNR multicast address (224.0.0.252) and responding with a user-defined spoofed IP address.

vertices.shortDescription: NetBIOS Name Service Spoofer
vertices.fullDescription: This module forges NetBIOS Name Service (NBNS) responses. It will listen for NBNS requests sent to the local subnet's broadcast address and spoof a response, redirecting the querying machine to an IP of the attacker's choosing. Combined with auxiliary/capture/server/smb or capture/server/http_ntlm it is a highly effective means of collecting crackable hashes on common networks.  This module must be run as root and will bind to tcp/137 on all interfaces.

vertices.shortDescription: Pcap Replay Utility
vertices.fullDescription: Replay a pcap capture file

vertices.shortDescription: Airpwn TCP Hijack
vertices.fullDescription: TCP streams are 'protected' only in so much as the sequence  number is not guessable.   Wifi is shared media.   Got your nose.   Responses which do not begin with Header: Value assumed to be  HTML only and will have Header:Value data prepended. Responses  which do not include a Content-Length header will have one generated.

vertices.shortDescription: DNSpwn DNS Hijack
vertices.fullDescription: Race DNS responses and replace DNS queries

vertices.shortDescription: Oracle DB SQL Injection via SYS.DBMS_CDC_IPUBLISH.ALTER_HOTLOG_INTERNAL_CSOURCE
vertices.fullDescription: The module exploits an sql injection flaw in the ALTER_HOTLOG_INTERNAL_CSOURCE procedure of the PL/SQL package DBMS_CDC_IPUBLISH. Any user with execute privilege on the vulnerable package can exploit this vulnerability. By default, users granted EXECUTE_CATALOG_ROLE have the required privilege. Affected versions: Oracle Database Server versions 10gR1, 10gR2 and 11gR1. Fixed with October 2008 CPU.

vertices.shortDescription: Oracle DB SQL Injection via SYS.DBMS_CDC_PUBLISH.ALTER_AUTOLOG_CHANGE_SOURCE
vertices.fullDescription: The module exploits an sql injection flaw in the ALTER_AUTOLOG_CHANGE_SOURCE procedure of the PL/SQL package DBMS_CDC_PUBLISH. Any user with execute privilege on the vulnerable package can exploit this vulnerability. By default, users granted EXECUTE_CATALOG_ROLE have the required privilege. Affected versions: Oracle Database Server versions 10gR1, 10gR2 and 11gR1. Fixed with October 2008 CPU.

vertices.shortDescription: Oracle DB SQL Injection via SYS.DBMS_CDC_PUBLISH.DROP_CHANGE_SOURCE
vertices.fullDescription: The module exploits an sql injection flaw in the DROP_CHANGE_SOURCE procedure of the PL/SQL package DBMS_CDC_PUBLISH. Any user with execute privilege on the vulnerable package can exploit this vulnerability. By default, users granted EXECUTE_CATALOG_ROLE have the required privilege.

vertices.shortDescription: Oracle DB SQL Injection via SYS.DBMS_CDC_PUBLISH.CREATE_CHANGE_SET
vertices.fullDescription: The module exploits an sql injection flaw in the CREATE_CHANGE_SET procedure of the PL/SQL package DBMS_CDC_PUBLISH. Any user with execute privilege on the vulnerable package can exploit this vulnerability. By default, users granted EXECUTE_CATALOG_ROLE have the required privilege.

vertices.shortDescription: Oracle DB SQL Injection via SYS.DBMS_CDC_SUBSCRIBE.ACTIVATE_SUBSCRIPTION
vertices.fullDescription: This module will escalate a Oracle DB user to DBA by exploiting an sql injection bug in the SYS.DBMS_CDC_SUBSCRIBE.ACTIVATE_SUBSCRIPTION package/function. This vulnerability affects to Oracle Database Server 9i up to 9.2.0.5 and 10g up to 10.1.0.4.

vertices.shortDescription: Oracle DB SQL Injection via DBMS_EXPORT_EXTENSION
vertices.fullDescription: This module will escalate a Oracle DB user to DBA by exploiting an sql injection bug in the DBMS_EXPORT_EXTENSION.GET_DOMAIN_INDEX_METADATA package.  Note: This module has been tested against 9i, 10gR1 and 10gR2.

vertices.shortDescription: Oracle DB SQL Injection via SYS.DBMS_METADATA.GET_GRANTED_XML
vertices.fullDescription: This module will escalate a Oracle DB user to DBA by exploiting an sql injection bug in the SYS.DBMS_METADATA.GET_GRANTED_XML package/function.

vertices.shortDescription: Oracle DB SQL Injection via SYS.DBMS_METADATA.GET_XML
vertices.fullDescription: This module will escalate a Oracle DB user to DBA by exploiting an sql injection bug in the SYS.DBMS_METADATA.GET_XML package/function.

vertices.shortDescription: Oracle DB SQL Injection via SYS.DBMS_METADATA.OPEN
vertices.fullDescription: This module will escalate a Oracle DB user to DBA by exploiting an sql injection bug in the SYS.DBMS_METADATA.OPEN package/function.

vertices.shortDescription: Oracle DB SQL Injection in MDSYS.SDO_TOPO_DROP_FTBL Trigger
vertices.fullDescription: This module will escalate a Oracle DB user to MDSYS by exploiting an sql injection bug in the MDSYS.SDO_TOPO_DROP_FTBL trigger. After that exploit escalate user to DBA using "CREATE ANY TRIGGER" privilege given to MDSYS user by creating evil trigger in system scheme (2-stage attack).

vertices.shortDescription: Oracle DB 10gR2, 11gR1/R2 DBMS_JVM_EXP_PERMS OS Command Execution
vertices.fullDescription: This module exploits a flaw (0 day) in DBMS_JVM_EXP_PERMS package that allows any user with create session privilege to grant themselves java IO privileges. Identified by David Litchfield. Works on 10g R2, 11g R1 and R2 (Windows only)

vertices.shortDescription: Oracle DB 11g R1/R2 DBMS_JVM_EXP_PERMS OS Code Execution
vertices.fullDescription: This module exploits a flaw (0 day) in DBMS_JVM_EXP_PERMS package that allows any user with create session privilege to grant themselves java IO privileges. Identified by David Litchfield. Works on 11g R1 and R2 (Windows only).

vertices.shortDescription: Oracle DB SQL Injection via SYS.LT.COMPRESSWORKSPACE
vertices.fullDescription: This module exploits an sql injection flaw in the COMPRESSWORKSPACE procedure of the PL/SQL package SYS.LT. Any user with execute privilege on the vulnerable package can exploit this vulnerability.

vertices.shortDescription: Oracle DB SQL Injection via SYS.LT.FINDRICSET Evil Cursor Method
vertices.fullDescription: This module will escalate a Oracle DB user to DBA by exploiting an sql injection bug in the SYS.LT.FINDRICSET package via Evil Cursor technique. Tested on oracle 10.1.0.3.0 -- should work on thru 10.1.0.5.0 and supposedly on 11g. Fixed with Oracle Critical Patch update October 2007.

vertices.shortDescription: Oracle DB SQL Injection via SYS.LT.MERGEWORKSPACE
vertices.fullDescription: This module exploits an sql injection flaw in the MERGEWORKSPACE procedure of the PL/SQL package SYS.LT. Any user with execute privilege on the vulnerable package can exploit this vulnerability.

vertices.shortDescription: Oracle DB SQL Injection via SYS.LT.REMOVEWORKSPACE
vertices.fullDescription: This module exploits an sql injection flaw in the REMOVEWORKSPACE procedure of the PL/SQL package SYS.LT. Any user with execute privilege on the vulnerable package can exploit this vulnerability.

vertices.shortDescription: Oracle DB SQL Injection via SYS.LT.ROLLBACKWORKSPACE
vertices.fullDescription: This module exploits an sql injection flaw in the ROLLBACKWORKSPACE procedure of the PL/SQL package SYS.LT. Any user with execute privilege on the vulnerable package can exploit this vulnerability.

vertices.shortDescription: Asterisk Manager Login Utility
vertices.fullDescription: This module attempts to authenticate to an Asterisk Manager service. Please note that by default, Asterisk Call Management (port 5038) only listens locally, but this can be manually configured in file /etc/asterisk/manager.conf by the admin on the victim machine.

vertices.shortDescription: SIP Deregister Extension
vertices.fullDescription: This module will will attempt to deregister a SIP user from the provider. It has been tested successfully when the sip provider/server doesn't use REGISTER authentication.

vertices.shortDescription: SIP Invite Spoof
vertices.fullDescription: This module will create a fake SIP invite request making the targeted device ring and display fake caller id information.

vertices.shortDescription: VSploit Mariposa DNS Query Module
vertices.fullDescription: This module queries known Mariposa Botnet DNS records.

vertices.shortDescription: VSploit DNS Beaconing Emulation
vertices.fullDescription: This module takes a list and emulates malicious DNS beaconing.

vertices.shortDescription: VSploit Zeus DNS Query Module
vertices.fullDescription: This module queries known Zeus Botnet DNS records.

vertices.shortDescription: VSploit Email PII
vertices.fullDescription: This auxiliary reads from a file and sends data which  should be flagged via an internal or external SMTP server.

vertices.shortDescription: VSploit Web PII
vertices.fullDescription: This module emulates a webserver leaking PII data

vertices.shortDescription: AIX Gather Dump Password Hashes
vertices.fullDescription: Post Module to dump the password hashes for all users on an AIX System

vertices.shortDescription: Gather Cisco Device General Information
vertices.fullDescription: This module collects a Cisco IOS or NXOS device information and configuration.

vertices.shortDescription: Linux Gather Virtual Environment Detection
vertices.fullDescription: This module attempts to determine whether the system is running inside of a virtual environment and if so, which one. This module supports detection of Hyper-V, VMWare, VirtualBox, Xen, and QEMU/KVM.

vertices.shortDescription: Linux Gather Configurations
vertices.fullDescription: This module collects configuration files found on commonly installed applications and services, such as Apache, MySQL, Samba, Sendmail, etc. If a config file is found in its default path, the module will assume that is the file we want.

vertices.shortDescription: Linux Gather Network Information
vertices.fullDescription: This module gathers network information from the target system IPTables rules, interfaces, wireless information, open and listening ports, active network connections, DNS information and SSH information.

vertices.shortDescription: Linux Gather Protection Enumeration
vertices.fullDescription: This module tries to find certain installed applications that can be used to prevent, or detect our attacks, which is done by locating certain binary locations, and see if they are indeed executables. For example, if we are able to run 'snort' as a command, we assume it's one of the files we are looking for.  This module is meant to cover various antivirus, rootkits, IDS/IPS, firewalls, and other software.

vertices.shortDescription: Linux Gather System and User Information
vertices.fullDescription: This module gathers system information. We collect installed packages, installed services, mount information, user list, user bash history and cron jobs

vertices.shortDescription: Linux Gather User History
vertices.fullDescription: This module gathers user specific information. User list, bash history, mysql history, vim history, lastlog and sudoers.

vertices.shortDescription: Linux Gather XChat Enumeration
vertices.fullDescription: This module will collect XChat's config files and chat logs from the victim's machine. There are three actions you may choose: CONFIGS, CHATS, and ALL. The CONFIGS option can be used to collect information such as channel settings, channel/server passwords, etc. The CHATS option will simply download all the .log files.

vertices.shortDescription: Linux Gather Dump Password Hashes for Linux Systems
vertices.fullDescription: Post Module to dump the password hashes for all users on a Linux System

vertices.shortDescription: Linux Gather Saved mount.cifs/mount.smbfs Credentials
vertices.fullDescription: Post Module to obtain credentials saved for mount.cifs/mount.smbfs in /etc/fstab on a Linux system.

vertices.shortDescription: Linux Gather PPTP VPN chap-secrets Credentials
vertices.fullDescription: This module collects PPTP VPN information such as client, server, password, and IP from your target server's chap-secrets file.

vertices.shortDescription: Linux Manage Download and Exececute
vertices.fullDescription: This module downloads and runs a file with bash. It first tries to uses curl as its HTTP client and then wget if it's not found. Bash found in the PATH is used to execute the file.

vertices.shortDescription: Metasploit pcap_log Local Privilege Escalation
vertices.fullDescription: Metasploit < 4.4 contains a vulnerable 'pcap_log' plugin which, when used with the default settings, creates pcap files in /tmp with predictable file names. This exploits this by hard-linking these filenames to /etc/passwd, then sending a packet with a priviliged user entry contained within. This, and all the other packets, are appended to /etc/passwd.  Successful exploitation results in the creation of a new superuser account.  This module requires manual clean-up. Upon success, you should remove /tmp/msf3-session*pcap files and truncate /etc/passwd. Note that if this module fails, you can potentially induce a permanent DoS on the target by corrupting the /etc/passwd file.

vertices.shortDescription: Windows Gather Apple iOS MobileSync Backup File Collection
vertices.fullDescription: This module will collect sensitive files from any on-disk iOS device backups

vertices.shortDescription: Multi Gather DNS Forward Lookup Bruteforce
vertices.fullDescription: Brute force subdomains and hostnames via wordlist.

vertices.shortDescription: Multi Gather DNS Reverse Lookup Scan
vertices.fullDescription: Performs DNS reverse lookup using the OS included DNS query command.

vertices.shortDescription: Multi Gather DNS Service Record Lookup Scan
vertices.fullDescription: Enumerates know SRV Records for a given domaon using target host DNS query tool.

vertices.shortDescription: Multi Gather VirtualBox VM Enumeration
vertices.fullDescription: This module will attempt to enumerate any VirtualBox VMs on the target machine.  Due to the nature of VirtualBox, this module can only enumerate VMs registered  for the current user, thereforce, this module needs to be invoked from a user context.

vertices.shortDescription: Multi Gather Generic Operating System Environment Settings
vertices.fullDescription: This module prints out the operating system environment variables

vertices.shortDescription: UNIX Gather .fetchmailrc Credentials
vertices.fullDescription: Post Module to obtain credentials saved for IMAP, POP and other mail retrieval protocols in fetchmail's .fetchmailrc

vertices.shortDescription: Multi Gather FileZilla FTP Client Credential Collection
vertices.fullDescription: This module will collect credentials from the FileZilla FTP client if it is installed.

vertices.shortDescription: Multi Gather VMWare VM Identification
vertices.fullDescription: This module will attempt to find any VMWare virtual machines stored on the target.

vertices.shortDescription: Multi Gather Firefox Signon Credential Collection
vertices.fullDescription: This module will collect credentials from the Firefox web browser if it is installed on the targeted machine. Additionally, cookies are downloaded. Which could potentially yield valid web sessions.  Firefox stores passwords within the signons.sqlite database file. There is also a keys3.db file which contains the key for decrypting these passwords. In cases where a Master Password has not been set, the passwords can easily be decrypted using third party tools. If a Master Password was used the only option would be to bruteforce.

vertices.shortDescription: Multi Gather GnuPG Credentials Collection
vertices.fullDescription: This module will collect the contents of user's .gnupg directory on the targeted machine. Password protected secret keyrings can be cracked with JtR.

vertices.shortDescription: Multi Gather Run Shell Command Resource File
vertices.fullDescription: This module will read shell commands from a resource file and execute the commands in the specified Meterpreter or shell session.

vertices.shortDescription: UNIX Gather .netrc Credentials
vertices.fullDescription: Post Module to obtain credentials saved for FTP and other services in .netrc

vertices.shortDescription: Multi Gather pgpass Credentials
vertices.fullDescription: This module will collect the contents of user's .pgpass or pgpass.conf and parse them for credentials.

vertices.shortDescription: Multi Gather Pidgin Instant Messenger Credential Collection
vertices.fullDescription: This module will collect credentials from the Pidgin IM client if it is installed.

vertices.shortDescription: Multi Gather Ping Sweep
vertices.fullDescription: Performs IPv4 ping sweep using the OS included ping command.

vertices.shortDescription: Multi Gather Run Console Resource File
vertices.fullDescription: This module will read console commands from a resource file and execute the commands in the specified Meterpreter session.

vertices.shortDescription: Multi Gather Skype User Data Enumeration
vertices.fullDescription: This module will enumerate Skype account settings, contact list, call history, chat logs, file transfer history, and voicemail logs, saving all the data to CSV files for analysis.

vertices.shortDescription: Multi Gather OpenSSH PKI Credentials Collection
vertices.fullDescription: This module will collect the contents of user's .ssh directory on the targeted machine. Additionally, known_hosts and authorized_keys and any other files are also downloaded. This module is largely based on firefox_creds.rb.

vertices.shortDescription: Multi Gather Mozilla Thunderbird Signon Credential Collection
vertices.fullDescription: This module will collect credentials from Mozilla Thunderbird by downloading the necessary files such as 'signons.sqlite', 'key3.db', and 'cert8.db' for offline decryption with third party tools.  If necessary, you may also set the PARSE optioin to true to parse the sqlite file, which contains sensitive information such as the encrypted username/password. However, this feature is not enabled by default, because it requires SQLITE3 gem to be installed on your machine.

vertices.shortDescription: Multi Generic Operating System Session Close
vertices.fullDescription: This module closes the specified session. This can be useful as a finisher for automation tasks

vertices.shortDescription: Multi Generic Operating System Session Command Execution
vertices.fullDescription: This module executes an arbitrary command line

vertices.shortDescription: Multi Manage Post Module Macro Execution
vertices.fullDescription: This module will execute a list of modules given in a macro file in the format of <module> <opt=val,opt=val> against the select session checking for compatibility of the module against the sessions and validation of the options provided.

vertices.shortDescription: Multi Manage Record Microphone
vertices.fullDescription: This module will enable and record your target's microphone. For non-Windows targets, please use Java meterpreter to be able to use this feature.

vertices.shortDescription: Multiple Linux / Unix Post Sudo Upgrade Shell
vertices.fullDescription: This module attempts to upgrade a shell account to UID 0 by reusing the given password and passing it to sudo. This technique relies on sudo versions from 2008 and later which support -A.

vertices.shortDescription: Multi Manage System Remote TCP Shell Session
vertices.fullDescription: This module will create a Reverse TCP Shell on the target system using the system own scripting enviroments installed on the target.

vertices.shortDescription: OS X Text to Speech Utility
vertices.fullDescription: This module will speak whatever is in the 'TEXT' option on the victim machine.

vertices.shortDescription: OS X Gather Adium Enumeration
vertices.fullDescription: This module will collect Adium's account plist files and chat logs from the victim's machine. There are three different actions you may choose: ACCOUNTS, CHATS, and ALL. Note that to use the 'CHATS' action, make sure you set the regex 'PATTERN' option in order to look for certain log names (which consists of a contact's name, and a timestamp). The current 'PATTERN' option is configured to look for any log created on February 2012 as an example. To loot both account plists and chat logs, simply set the action to 'ALL'.

vertices.shortDescription: OS X Gather Airport Wireless Preferences
vertices.fullDescription: This module will download OS X Airport Wireless preferences from the victim machine. The preferences file (which is a plist) contains information such as: SSID, Channels, Security Type, Password ID, etc.

vertices.shortDescription: OS X Gather Chicken of the VNC Profile
vertices.fullDescription: This module will download the "Chicken of the VNC" client application's profile file, which is used to store other VNC servers' information such as as the IP and password.

vertices.shortDescription: OS X Gather Colloquy Enumeration
vertices.fullDescription: This module will collect Colloquy's info plist file and chat logs from the victim's machine. There are three actions you may choose: INFO, CHATS, and ALL. Please note that the CHAT action may take a long time depending on the victim machine, therefore we suggest to set the regex 'PATTERN' option in order to search for certain log names (which consists of the contact's name, and a timestamp). The default 'PATTERN' is configured as "^alien" as an example to search for any chat logs associated with the name "alien".

vertices.shortDescription: OS X Gather Keychain Enumeration
vertices.fullDescription: This module presents a way to quickly go through the current user's keychains and collect data such as email accounts, servers, and other services. Please note: when using the GETPASS option, the user will have to manually enter the password, and then click 'allow' in order to collect each password.

vertices.shortDescription: OS X Gather Mac OS X System Information Enumeration
vertices.fullDescription: This module gathers basic system information from Mac OS X Tiger, Leopard, Snow Leopard and Lion systems.

vertices.shortDescription: OS X Gather Mac OS X Password Hash Collector
vertices.fullDescription: This module dumps SHA-1, LM and NT Hashes of Mac OS X Tiger, Leopard, Snow Leopard and Lion Systems.

vertices.shortDescription: Cisco IOS Gather Configuration
vertices.fullDescription: This module will attempt to gather device information from a session   on a Cisco IOS device.

vertices.shortDescription: Unknown Device Gather Info
vertices.fullDescription: This module will attempt to get information about unknown devices.

vertices.shortDescription: Metasploit Pro Persistent Agent
vertices.fullDescription: Install a persistent agent (in-memory or on-disk) with a maximum execution time

vertices.shortDescription: Metasploit Pro Persistent Agent Cleaner
vertices.fullDescription: Remove a persistent agent installed by the Agent module

vertices.shortDescription: Pro: Multi Gather Hashdump
vertices.fullDescription: This module will attempt to gather passwd and shadow files from the target.   If it is able to retrieve both, it will attempt to unshadow them as well   for future cracking.

vertices.shortDescription: Unix Gather System Info
vertices.fullDescription: This module will gather system information about the target.

vertices.shortDescription: Metasploit Pro Post Exploitation Macro Launcher
vertices.fullDescription: Execute a macro that was defined in the Metasploit Pro user interface.

vertices.shortDescription: Windows Escalate GetSystem
vertices.fullDescription: This module will attempt to escalate priviliges using the getsystem command.

vertices.shortDescription: Windows Gather Network Info
vertices.fullDescription: This module will gather files matching the supplied pattern.

vertices.shortDescription: Windows Gather Network Info
vertices.fullDescription: This module will gather network configuration information about the target.

vertices.shortDescription: Windows Gather Process List
vertices.fullDescription: This module will gather the list of running processes on the target.

vertices.shortDescription: Windows Capture Desktop Screenshot
vertices.fullDescription: This module will take a snapshot of the interactive desktop. If a screeensaver is running, it will be stopped prior to the screenshot being taken.

vertices.shortDescription: Windows Gather System Info
vertices.fullDescription: This module will gather system information about the Windows Session.

vertices.shortDescription: Windows Gather System Info (Shell)
vertices.fullDescription: This module will gather system information about the Windows Session.   This module is for shell sessions instead of meterpreter.

vertices.shortDescription: Solaris Gather Virtual Environment Detection
vertices.fullDescription: This module attempts to determine whether the system is running inside of a virtual environment and if so, which one. This module supports detectoin of Solaris Zone, VMWare, VirtualBox, Xen, and QEMU/KVM.

vertices.shortDescription: Solaris Gather Installed Packages
vertices.fullDescription: Post Module to enumerate installed packages on a Solaris System

vertices.shortDescription: Solaris Gather Configured Services
vertices.fullDescription: Post Module to enumerate services on a Solaris System

vertices.shortDescription: Solaris Gather Dump Password Hashes for Solaris Systems
vertices.fullDescription: Post Module to dump the password hashes for all users on a Solaris System

vertices.shortDescription: Windows Capture Keystroke Recorder
vertices.fullDescription: This module can be used to capture keystrokes. To capture keystrokes when the session is running as SYSTEM, the MIGRATE option must be enabled and the CAPTURE_TYPE option should be set to one of Explorer, Winlogon, or a specific PID. To capture the keystrokes of the interactive user, the Explorer option should be used with MIGRATE enabled. Keep in mind that this will demote this session to the user's privileges, so it makes sense to create a separate session for this task. The Winlogon option will capture the username and password entered into the logon and unlock dialog. The LOCKSCREEN option can be combined with the Winlogon CAPTURE_TYPE to for the user to enter their clear-text password.

vertices.shortDescription: Winlogon Lockout Credential Keylogger
